name: Lahaina Inn

reviews.title: Great Disappointment.
reviews.text: The photographer who photographed the rooms should get a Oscar. The room was so tiny my husband and I couldn't move around at the same time. No room for a chair, barely room for our suitcase. Reminded me of the space on a ship or a train cabin. The bathroom shower had a moldy smell. The coverlet on the bed was soiled. I know antiques, but these were just very tired and old furnishings. The bed creaked and was uncomfortable. We didn't bother to complain as the demeanor of the owner put a new spin on the adjective "unfriendly" and "could care less".

reviews.title: Definitely won't go back
reviews.text: After we checked out, after 5 days, we received a call from another guest who left after we did. They reported seeing 2 rats running down the hall and in the community room. Also, one of the women went back to California covered with bed bug bites.

I am going to contact Fodors and Frommers, this place should not be recommended. It is not right to depend on their reviews and end up in this place with no hope of checking out. First, you lose your deposit and second every place else is booked. If I had known about the rodents and bedbugs I would have left even if it meant sleeping in our rental car.
reviews.title: Cozy and Romantic
LOVED this place!
reviews.text: We did check out the Plantation Inn during our stay, and it was lovely. The rooms were large, bright, had TV's, they have a lovely breakfast room, (serve a full breakfast, plus a voucher toward dinner in their very nice restaurant) free parking, swimming pool. When comparing the price with the Lahaina Inn there is much more value for the Plantation.

reviews.title: A nice little inn in a fun place
reviews.text: We stayed at the Inn for 3 nights. After the first night, considered leaving early, but didn't out of inertia and fear that we would fail to find another place and/or not get a refund. (they said we could if they were able to rent it.)

When my boyfriend and I first arrived in Lahaina, we were a bit overwhelmed by all of the people and noise. It turned out that it was nice to not have to drive every time we wanted to eat but next time, I think we will stay in a condo in Napili or on the outskirts of Lahaina.
reviews.title: too bad about the location!

reviews.text: As for the hotel, it is located 1/2 a block from Front St. This is both a blessing and a curse. It is great because everything is within walking distance, but at night, the location can translate into a LOT of noise (out of 6 nights, it wasn't too bad except for one night when there were screaming people in streets until about 3 am). Also, there is a restaurant downstairs that gets deliveries in between 5:30 and 7am every day except for Sunday. The truck leaves it's engine and cooler running every day and it is exceptionally loud. It turned out not to be as bad as it sounds because it helped us get up early in the morning and beat all of the crowds. I talked to one of the owners about it on our last day and she told me that she has to argue with them every week about it. If you stay at the hotel and hear it, tell one of the owners and they will try to fix the problem. Both of the women who own the place were really nice and responsive to our requests.
reviews.title: The Bottom Line

likes.disliked: — COuldn't find the ice the first two nights I was there

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Makai suite and found it to be spacious and clean. The bed was comfy and by the time we left, it started to feel like home. Some people wrote about the floor being sticky and it was, but only on our first day. As for amenities, the suite has a small fridge, A/C and a fantastic lanai overlooking the ocean. It could use more room for clothing storage, but there was a large-ish wardrobe.
reviews.title: Quicky and all the better for it.

likes.liked: — It's different and has it's own vibe

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I peeped my head into some of the other rooms and some of them are just big enough for a bed and one person. If you are concerned about space, it is well worth it to stay in the Makai suite. Overall, I think it is sad that such a great place to stay is in such a loud and disruptive location.
reviews.title: Charming Inn just off Maui's busy Front Street

likes.liked: — The balcony and the antique furnishings

reviews.text: I read all the other reviews and then felt compelled to write one myself. Let me clarify a few things - the room I stayed in was small. and there was no TV. My bags occupied a lot of space in the room. As this wasn't a traditional hotel I was used to, I wasn't sure I would enjoy it.
reviews.title: Great Place and Better Location
have always enjoyed this Inn
reviews.text: I am planning a 50th birthday trip for my husband in a few months time ,and we have visited the Lahaina Inn on at least 4 occasions over the last 15 years without a hitch.The comments I have read are a little deceiving.Yes , the standard rooms are small,but we loved the old world atmosphere and the central location.For those sour pusses who have no sense of smell, those cinnamon smells are WONDERFUL!They must be hooked on the smell of Spray and Wipe! For heavens sake, take yourselves away from the tyranny of the ubiquitous TV/internet and all the dross that modern day society now loads us with,and enjoy for a couple of nights the action you see down below from your balcony! Brealfast used to be just a couple of croissants left in the hallway, so the idea of a community lounge sounds quite good for internet access(only to checkemails of course!) and coffee. As it will be a special occasion, we may book one of the larger rooms.I don't care about whirltubs etc and as an Inn owner myself(who shamefully offers alot of these 21st century options), I think this place is charming.It is not for everyone, but we used to just visit the resort beaches 10 minutes away by car. The buzz and restaurants in Lahaina are just a blast!!You DO need a car to travel during the day in all parts of Hawaii anyway.Far better than many dull boring resorts I have stayed in.You'll be getting a call from us soon!

We stayed at the Lahaina inn for 3 nights. It was an interesting experience but it is definitely not a place for everybody - you will either love it or hate it. For myself, I would have chosen another accommodation option if I were to do it again. I will try to be as objective as possible and here are some pointers:
reviews.title: It was OK...
Last time I stay anywhere billed as "cozy" or "quaint"
reviews.text: 1. I think Debbi is friendly and helpful. On the day of check-in she actually tried to carry our luggage to our rooms even though we had 3 guys in our group!

reviews.title: Quaint Rooms
reviews.text: 2. I was under the impression that it will have no TV, but I was pleasantly suprised that there was a TV in the community room with all the cable channels you need. They even provide high-speed internet access (you have to bring your own laptop). My group hangs out mostly in the community room, chatting, making tea, watching TV, checking email and looking at photos we took. There are other guests coming into the community room occasionally and they are all very nice and friendly people. I think it is the best part of the whole experience. We stayed in 2 different places after this and I missed the community room.

description: This boutique inn was recently remodeled and is situated in the heart of historic Lahaina Town. Just off of Front Street guests enjoy easy access to the many local restaurants, bars, art galleries, shops, historical sites, and Lahaina Harbor. Lahaina Inn guests enjoy complimentary shuttle services to Kaanapali Beach and full access to the resort amenities and prime beachfront location at Lahaina Inn's sister property- the Royal Lahaina Resort.
